data.name: Btn_ClearSection
data.value: Clear all values in this section

data.name: RouteList_DeleteConfirm
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete route

data.name: RouteEdit_DisplayName_Desc
data.value: A display name for easy identification (stored in Metadata)

data.name: RouteEdit_OverwriteConfirm
data.value: Current data will be overwritten. Continue?

data.name: RouteEdit_JsonHelper
data.value: Enter valid JSON or leave empty

data.name: Auth_ProviderKey_Deprecated
data.value: Deprecated in v24.1 - use Provider Keys instead

data.name: Aggregate_DeleteConfirm
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete aggregate

data.name: DynamicRoute_DeleteConfirm
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete dynamic route

data.name: LB_RoundRobin_Desc
data.value: Distribute requests evenly across all hosts in turn

data.name: LB_LeastConnection_Desc
data.value: Route to the host with fewest active connections

data.name: LB_CookieStickySessions_Desc
data.value: Use cookie to keep same client on same host

data.name: LB_NoLoadBalancer_Desc
data.value: Always use the first available host

data.name: SD_Consul_Desc
data.value: Query HashiCorp Consul on each request

data.name: SD_PollConsul_Desc
data.value: Poll Consul at a fixed interval

data.name: SD_Kube_Desc
data.value: Query Kubernetes API on each request

data.name: SD_PollKube_Desc
data.value: Poll Kubernetes API at a fixed interval

data.name: HttpVersionPolicy_RequestVersionExact_Desc
data.value: Use only the specified HTTP version

data.name: NumberStyle_Integer_Desc
data.value: Digits, leading sign, trailing sign, leading/trailing whitespace

data.name: NumberStyle_Number_Desc
data.value: Digits, group separators, decimal point, signs

data.name: NumberStyle_Currency_Desc
data.value: All numeric styles including currency symbol

data.name: Import_Confirm_Message
data.value: This will replace all current settings. Continue?

data.name: Tip_UpstreamPath
data.value: The URL pattern that Ocelot matches against incoming client requests. Supports placeholders like {id} and catch-all {everything}.

data.name: Tip_HttpMethods
data.value: Select which HTTP methods this route will match. Leave empty to match all methods.

data.name: Tip_UpstreamHost
data.value: Optional host header filter. Only requests with this Host header will match this route.

data.name: Tip_DownstreamPath
data.value: The URL path that Ocelot forwards the request to on the downstream service. Use matching placeholders from upstream.

data.name: Tip_Scheme
data.value: The protocol used to communicate with the downstream service: https, http, ws (WebSocket), or wss (secure WebSocket).

data.name: Tip_HttpVersion
data.value: The HTTP version used for downstream requests. Common values: 1.1, 2.0. Leave empty for default.

data.name: Tip_DownstreamHttpMethod
data.value: Override the HTTP method for the downstream request. For example, convert an upstream GET to a downstream POST. Leave empty to use the same method as upstream.

data.name: Tip_HostAndPorts
data.value: The target server addresses. Add multiple hosts for load balancing. Each entry needs a hostname and port.

data.name: Tip_Key
data.value: A unique identifier for this route. Required when using service discovery or route aggregation.

data.name: Tip_Priority
data.value: Route matching priority. Lower numbers are matched first. Use when multiple routes could match the same request.

data.name: Tip_Timeout
data.value: Maximum time (in seconds) to wait for a downstream response before timing out.

data.name: Tip_CaseSensitive
data.value: Whether URL path matching is case-sensitive. Default is false (case-insensitive).

data.name: Tip_ServiceName
data.value: Service name for service discovery. Used with ServiceDiscoveryProvider in Global Config.

data.name: Tip_ServiceNamespace
data.value: Kubernetes namespace for the service. Only used with Kube-based service discovery.

data.name: Tip_RequestIdKey
data.value: Header name for request correlation ID. Overrides the global RequestIdKey for this route.

data.name: Tip_AcceptAnyCert
data.value: Accept any SSL/TLS certificate from downstream, including self-signed. Use only for development.

data.name: Tip_AuthenticationOptions
data.value: Configure authentication provider and allowed scopes for this route.

data.name: Tip_AuthorizationOptions
data.value: Define required claims and allowed values for route access control.

data.name: Tip_RateLimitOptions
data.value: Control request rate limiting: period, limit count, and client whitelist.

data.name: Tip_LoadBalancerOptions
data.value: Load balancing strategy across downstream hosts: RoundRobin, LeastConnection, or NoLoadBalancer.

data.name: Tip_QoSOptions
data.value: Quality of Service settings: circuit breaker thresholds, timeout exceptions, and duration of break.

data.name: Tip_CacheOptions
data.value: Response caching: TTL (seconds), cache region, and custom header for cache key.

data.name: Tip_SecurityOptions
data.value: IP allow/block lists for route-level security filtering.

data.name: Tip_HttpHandlerOptions
data.value: HTTP handler behavior: allow auto-redirect, use cookie container, use tracing, use proxy.

data.name: Guide_Subtitle
data.value: OcelotUI is a visual editor for Ocelot API Gateway configuration (ocelot.json). Ocelot routes client requests to downstream services based on URL patterns, HTTP methods, and headers.

data.name: Guide_QS1_Content
data.value: In appsettings.json, set "OcelotConfig": { "FilePath": "path/to/ocelot.json" }. The default is "ocelot.json" in the application directory. OcelotUI reads and writes this file directly.

data.name: Guide_QS2_Content
data.value: Go to Routes and click "Add Route". Fill in the Upstream Path (e.g. /api/users/{everything}) and Downstream Path (e.g. /users/{everything}), select a scheme (https), and add a downstream host and port. Click Save.

data.name: Guide_QS3_Content
data.value: All changes are saved directly to the ocelot.json file using atomic writes to prevent corruption. Reload your Ocelot gateway to pick up the new configuration. You can then refine routes, add options, or configure global defaults.

data.name: Guide_Routes_Content
data.value:
Routes are the core of Ocelot. Each route defines how a client request (Upstream) maps to a backend service (Downstream).
Upstream settings determine what to match: - Path Template: URL pattern with placeholders like {id} or catch-all {everything} - HTTP Methods: Which verbs to accept (GET, POST, etc.). Leave empty for all methods - Host: Optional Host header filter
Downstream settings determine where to forward: - Path Template: Target URL path (use same placeholders as upstream) - Scheme: Protocol (https, http, ws, wss) - Host & Ports: One or more target server addresses - HTTP Version: 1.1 or 2.0 (optional)
Additional fields: - Key: A unique ID for this route (required for Aggregates and some Rate Limit references) - Priority: Higher numbers match first when multiple routes could match - Timeout: Maximum wait time in seconds for a downstream response - ServiceName / ServiceNamespace: For service discovery integration

data.name: Guide_Routes_Tip
data.value: Use {everything} as a catch-all placeholder to proxy entire path segments. Example: Upstream /api/{everything} with Downstream /{everything} forwards all sub-paths.

data.name: Guide_CreateRoute_Content
data.value:
The Routes page lists all configured routes. From here you can: - Click "Add Route" to create a new route from scratch - Click the edit icon on any existing route to modify it - Click the delete icon to remove a route
When creating a new route, you can use "Apply Template" to quickly fill in common patterns: - Basic REST API: GET/POST/PUT/DELETE proxy - WebSocket: wss proxy for real-time connections - Catch-All: Forward an entire service path using {everything} - Rate Limited: API proxy with rate limiting pre-configured - Authenticated: Route with authentication settings - Load Balanced: Multi-target host with load balancing
Templates pre-fill the form but you can modify any field before saving.

data.name: Guide_CreateRoute_Tip
data.value: Templates overwrite existing form data. If you've already started editing, you'll see a confirmation prompt before the template is applied.

data.name: Guide_RouteOptions_Content
data.value:
Each route can have optional sub-property sections to control advanced behavior. Expand the corresponding panel in the route editor to configure them:
Authentication Options Assign authentication schemes (e.g. Bearer, JWT). Multiple keys are tried in order. Set AllowedScopes to restrict access by OAuth scope.
Rate Limit Options Control request frequency: set a Limit (max requests) and Period (e.g. 1m, 1h). Add a ClientWhitelist for exempt clients. The ClientIdHeader (default: Oc-Client) identifies who is making requests.
Load Balancer Options Distribute requests across multiple downstream hosts: RoundRobin, LeastConnection, CookieStickySessions, or NoLoadBalancer.
QoS Options (Quality of Service) Configure a circuit breaker: when FailureRatio is exceeded within SamplingDuration, the circuit opens for BreakDuration. Timeout sets the per-request deadline in milliseconds.
Cache Options Cache downstream responses. TtlSeconds controls how long responses are cached. Set a Region name for grouped cache invalidation. EnableContentHashing includes the request body in the cache key (useful for POST).
HTTP Handler Options Fine-tune the HTTP client: allow auto-redirects, enable cookie containers, use proxy, enable distributed tracing, and set connection pool limits.
Security Options Restrict access by client IP. Set IPAllowedList and/or IPBlockedList using individual IPs or CIDR notation (e.g. 10.0.0.0/24). ExcludeAllowedFromBlocked removes allowed IPs from the block list.

data.name: Guide_Transform_Content
data.value:
Routes support several Dictionary fields for transforming requests and responses:
Upstream Header Transform Modify headers before sending to downstream. Use placeholders: {RemoteIpAddress}, {TraceId}, {UpstreamHost}, {BaseUrl}, {DownstreamBaseUrl}. Example: X-Forwarded-For = {RemoteIpAddress}
Downstream Header Transform Modify response headers from downstream before returning to client. Supports find-and-replace. Example: Location = "http://internal/, http://public/" replaces the internal URL in Location headers.
Upstream Header Templates Match routes based on specific header values. Only requests with matching headers will use this route.
Route Claims Requirement Require specific JWT claims for access. Key = Claim Type, Value = Required Value. Returns 403 Forbidden if not met.
Add Claims / Headers / Queries to Request Extract values from JWT claims and inject them as new claims, HTTP headers, or query parameters. Syntax: Claims[ClaimType] > value[index] > delimiter Example: UserId = Claims[sub] > value[1] > |
Change Downstream Path Template Replace placeholders in the downstream path with values extracted from JWT claims.

data.name: Guide_Transform_Tip
data.value: Claims transformation runs after authentication. Make sure AuthenticationOptions is configured on the route before using claims-based features.

data.name: Guide_GlobalConfig_Content
data.value:
Global Configuration sets default values that apply to all routes. Route-level settings always override global defaults.
Basic settings: BaseUrl (your gateway's external URL), default DownstreamScheme, HTTP Version, Timeout, and RequestIdKey.
Sub-property defaults: You can set global defaults for Authentication, Rate Limit, Load Balancer, QoS, Cache, HTTP Handler, and Security. Each supports a "Route Keys" field to limit which routes inherit the setting.
Service Discovery: Configure a provider (Consul, Eureka, Kube, etc.) so routes can reference services by name instead of hardcoded host/port. Set Host, Port, Scheme, Token, and PollingInterval as needed.
Metadata Options: Configure how metadata string values are parsed into typed values — Culture, NumberStyle, Separators, StringSplitOption, and TrimChars.
Header Transforms: Global upstream/downstream header transforms apply to all static routes.
Metadata: Global key-value pairs accessible in custom middleware. Route-level Metadata overrides matching keys.

data.name: Guide_GlobalConfig_Tip
data.value: Use Route Keys on global sub-options to apply settings to specific routes only. Leave Route Keys empty to apply to all routes.

data.name: Guide_DynamicRoutes_Content
data.value:
Dynamic Routes work with Service Discovery to route requests without predefined path templates. Instead of mapping specific paths, you register a ServiceName and Ocelot resolves the target host/port at runtime.
This is useful when: - Services register and deregister dynamically (e.g. in Kubernetes or Consul) - You don't want to maintain a static route for every microservice - Host addresses change frequently
Dynamic routes support: Authentication, Rate Limiting, Load Balancing, QoS, Cache, HTTP Handler options, and Metadata — the same sub-properties as static routes (except Security).
To use dynamic routes, first configure a ServiceDiscoveryProvider in Global Configuration, then add a Dynamic Route with the target ServiceName.

data.name: Guide_Aggregates_Content
data.value:
Aggregates combine responses from multiple routes into a single JSON response. This reduces client round-trips by merging data from several backend services.
Setup: 1. Ensure each source route has a unique Key (set in the route editor) 2. Create an Aggregate with a unique UpstreamPathTemplate 3. Add those route Keys to the RouteKeys list
Route Keys Config (optional) enables chained requests where the output of one route feeds into another. Set JsonPath to extract a value from the first response, and Parameter to inject it into the second route's path.
Example: Fetch comments, then use the authorId from each comment to fetch user details. JsonPath "$[*].authorId" extracts the ID, and Parameter "userId" maps it to the {userId} placeholder in the second route.

data.name: Guide_Aggregates_Tip
data.value: Aggregates only support GET requests. The response Content-Type is always application/json, and individual response headers are not preserved.

data.name: Guide_Tips_Content
data.value:
Saving: All changes write directly to ocelot.json using atomic file operations. Your Ocelot gateway needs to be restarted or configured to watch for file changes to pick up edits.
Priority: When multiple routes could match the same request, use Priority to control which one wins. Higher numbers match first. Catch-all routes should have Priority 0 (the default).
Placeholders: Use {placeholder} in path templates to capture path segments. The same placeholder name must appear in both Upstream and Downstream templates. Use {everything} to match the entire remaining path.
Timeout hierarchy: QoS Timeout (ms) takes highest priority, then Route Timeout (sec), then Global Timeout (sec), then the default of 90 seconds.
Delegating Handlers: Add custom HttpMessageHandler class names to the DelegatingHandlers list. These are executed in order for each request through the route.
Unknown properties: The editor preserves any JSON properties it doesn't recognize. This ensures forward compatibility with newer Ocelot versions — custom or new properties won't be lost when you save.

data.name: Cache_TtlSeconds_Desc
data.value: Time-To-Live in seconds. Absolute expiration from when added to cache. 0 = disabled.

data.name: Cache_Region_Desc
data.value: Cache region name for clearing via Administration API.

data.name: Cache_Header_Desc
data.value: Header name for Ocelot caching control. Varying values create different cache keys.

data.name: Cache_EnableContentHashing_Desc
data.value: Include request body hash in cache key. Recommended for POST/PUT routes.

data.name: QoS_BreakDuration_Desc
data.value: Duration the circuit stays open before resetting (500–86,400,000 ms).

data.name: QoS_MinimumThroughput_Desc
data.value: Minimum actions in sampling window before circuit breaker engages (≥ 2).

data.name: QoS_FailureRatio_Desc
data.value: Failure-to-success ratio to trigger circuit break (0.0 < x ≤ 1.0).

data.name: QoS_SamplingDuration_Desc
data.value: Sampling window for failure ratio assessment (500–86,400,000 ms).

data.name: QoS_Timeout_Desc
data.value: Default request timeout in milliseconds (10–86,400,000 ms).

data.name: LoadBalancer_Key_Desc
data.value: Cookie name for sticky sessions. Only for CookieStickySessions.

data.name: LoadBalancer_Expiry_Desc
data.value: Session stickiness duration in ms. Refreshes on each request. Default: 1,200,000 (20 min).

data.name: RateLimit_Enable_Desc
data.value: Controls whether rate limiting applies to this route.

data.name: RateLimit_Limit_Desc
data.value: Maximum requests allowed within the specified Period.

data.name: RateLimit_Period_Desc
data.value: Time window for counting requests. Format: number + unit (ms/s/m/h/d).

data.name: RateLimit_Wait_Desc
data.value: Duration to block requests after quota exhaustion. Same format as Period.

data.name: RateLimit_ClientIdHeader_Desc
data.value: HTTP header that contains the client identifier. Default: "Oc-Client".

data.name: RateLimit_ClientWhitelist_Desc
data.value: Client identifiers exempted from rate limiting.

data.name: RateLimit_EnableHeaders_Desc
data.value: Include X-RateLimit-* and Retry-After headers in responses.

data.name: RateLimit_StatusCode_Desc
data.value: HTTP status code for rate limit rejections. Default: 429.

data.name: RateLimit_QuotaMessage_Desc
data.value: Custom message when quota exceeded. Supports {0} (count) and {1} (period).

data.name: RateLimit_KeyPrefix_Desc
data.value: Cache key prefix for rate limit counters. Default: "Ocelot.RateLimiting".

data.name: Auth_AllowAnonymous_Desc
data.value: Exclude this route from global authentication when true.

data.name: Auth_ProviderKeys_Desc
data.value: Authentication provider schemes. First One Wins strategy by array order.

data.name: Auth_ProviderKey_Desc
data.value: Deprecated in v24.1. Use Authentication Provider Keys instead.

data.name: Auth_AllowedScopes_Desc
data.value: Required scopes from the token's scope claim. At least one must match.

data.name: HttpHandler_UseCookieContainer_Desc
data.value: Enable cookie persistence for downstream requests.

data.name: HttpHandler_UseProxy_Desc
data.value: Use system proxy settings for downstream requests.

data.name: HttpHandler_MaxConnections_Desc
data.value: Maximum concurrent connections per downstream server.

data.name: HttpHandler_PooledLifetime_Desc
data.value: Connection pool reuse duration in seconds. Default: 120.

data.name: ServiceDiscovery_Host_Desc
data.value: Service discovery server hostname or IP address.

data.name: ServiceDiscovery_Scheme_Desc
data.value: Protocol for connecting to the discovery provider (http/https).

data.name: ServiceDiscovery_Token_Desc
data.value: Authentication token for ACL-protected Consul instances.

data.name: ServiceDiscovery_ConfigurationKey_Desc
data.value: Key for storing/retrieving config in Consul KV store.

data.name: ServiceDiscovery_PollingInterval_Desc
data.value: Polling frequency in ms for PollConsul/PollKube providers.

data.name: ServiceDiscovery_Namespace_Desc
data.value: Kubernetes namespace. Not supported for Consul.

data.name: Warn_NoDownstreamHost
data.value: No downstream host or service name configured. This route won't be able to forward requests.

data.name: Warn_NoHttpMethod
data.value: No HTTP methods specified. This route will match all methods.

data.name: Warn_RateLimitIncomplete
data.value: Rate limiting is enabled but Period or Limit is not set.

data.name: Warn_AuthNoProvider
data.value: Authentication is configured but no provider key is specified.

data.name: History_RestoreConfirm
data.value: Are you sure you want to restore to this version?

data.name: History_RestoreConfirmDetail
data.value: Restore to the snapshot from {0}? This version contains {1} route(s). A backup of the current state will be created automatically.

data.name: History_DeleteConfirm
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete this snapshot?

data.name: History_ClearAllConfirm
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete all snapshots? This cannot be undone.

data.name: MetadataOpt_CurrentCulture_Desc
data.value: CultureInfo used for metadata value parsing.

data.name: MetadataOpt_Separators_Desc
data.value: Delimiter strings used to split metadata values. Default: comma.

data.name: MetadataOpt_TrimChars_Desc
data.value: Characters to trim from parsed metadata values. Default: space.
